meanings.sent1: She warks hard every day to provide for her family.
meanings.sent2: The construction workers warks diligently to finish the building on time.
meanings.sent3: After warking in the garden all day, her muscles were sore but satisfied.
meanings.sent4: The engine warks tirelessly to keep the machine running smoothly.
meanings.sent5: The ants warks together to carry the food back to their nest.

meanings.definition: Warks (noun): aches or pains in the body
meanings.sent1: He complained of warks in his back after lifting heavy boxes.
meanings.sent2: She massaged her legs to relieve the warks from standing all day.
meanings.sent3: The old chair gave him warks in places he didn't know existed.
meanings.sent4: The athlete ignored the warks in his muscles and continued to push himself.
meanings.sent5: The soothing balm helped alleviate the warks in her shoulders.

meanings.sent1: The warks shoes left blisters on her feet.
meanings.sent2: The warks chair made it hard to sit for long periods.
meanings.sent3: The warks weather made everyone stay indoors.
meanings.sent4: The warks truth was difficult for him to accept.
meanings.sent5: The warks sound of the alarm clock startled her awake.
